Supports multiple passkeys via 2-byte keyIds; any single credential can sign.      KNOWN SECURITY CONSIDERATIONS:      Recovery supports in-place rotation: When replace is true in the recovery struct,      the credential at keyId has its public key overwritten in-place. When replace is      false, recovery is additive (new credential added, existing keys remain).      Cross-chain merkle signing requires same contract address: _passkeyMultichain() uses      _hashTypedDataSansChainId which omits chainId but still includes verifyingContract in      the EIP-712 domain separator. NOTE: Unlike the stateful validation paths (validateUserOp, isValidSignatureWithSender)      which return false/VALIDATION_FAILED on invalid input per ERC-4337, this function REVERTS      on malformed input (InvalidSignatureData, ProofTooLong, InvalidMerkleProof). The `data` layout starts with a 20-byte account address (for challenge binding),      followed by the credential/proof data:        [0:20]    account (address, bound into the challenge)        [20]      proofLength (uint8)        if proofLength == 0 (regular signing, challenge = _passkeyDigest(account, hash)):          [21:53]                        pubKeyX          [53:85]                        pubKeyY        if proofLength > 0 (merkle proof, challenge = _passkeyMultichain(merkleRoot)):          [21:53]                        merkleRoot (bytes32)          [53:53+proofLength*32]         proof (bytes32[])          [proofEnd:proofEnd+32]         pubKeyX          [proofEnd+32:proofEnd+64]      pubKeyY      `signature` is packed WebAuthnAuth (see P256Lib.parseWebAuthnAuth for format).","params":{"data":"Packed account, credential, and proof data as described above","hash":"The digest to validate (or combined with account for a merkle leaf)","signature":"Packed WebAuthnAuth struct (r, s, challengeIndex, typeIndex, authenticatorData, clientDataJSON)"},"returns":{"_0":"True if the signature is valid for the provided credentials"}},"validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,bytes,bytes32,uint256,bytes32,bytes,bytes),bytes32)":{"details":"The account address is userOp.sender, NOT msg.sender (msg.sender is the EntryPoint). addCredential(uint16,bytes32,bytes32).details: msg.sender is the smart account calling this function directly (not via entrypoint).      The module must already be installed (isInitialized check in _addCredential), preventing      credentials from being added before onInstall establishes the account's credential set.

params.pubKeyX: X coordinate of the P-256 public key (validated to be on curve)
params.pubKeyY: Y coordinate of the P-256 public key (validated to be on curve)

returns._0: The count of currently registered credentials

getAccountLeaf(address,bytes32).details: For merkle batch signing, each leaf is keccak256(abi.encode(account, digest))      rather than the raw digest. This binds each leaf to a specific smart account,      enabling multi-account merkle trees where a single signature authorizes      operations across multiple accounts.

params.account: The smart account address to bind into the leaf
params.digest: The operation digest for this account

getCredential(uint16,address).details: Returns (0, 0) if the credential does not exist.

params.account: The smart account address that owns the credential

returns.pubKeyX: X coordinate of the P-256 public key (bytes32(0) if not found)
returns.pubKeyY: Y coordinate of the P-256 public key (bytes32(0) if not found)

getPasskeyDigest(address,bytes32).details: Public convenience wrapper around _passkeyDigest for off-chain tooling to compute      the exact challenge bytes the passkey must sign for regular (non-merkle) operations.

params.account: The smart account this challenge is bound to

returns._0: The EIP-712 typed data hash to be used as the WebAuthn challenge

getPasskeyMultichain(bytes32).details: Public convenience wrapper around _passkeyMultichain for off-chain tooling to      compute the exact challenge bytes the passkey must sign for merkle batch operations.

params.root: The merkle root of the operation digest tree

returns._0: The chain-agnostic EIP-712 typed data hash to be used as the WebAuthn challenge

getRecoverDigest(address,uint256,(uint16.details: Uses `_hashTypedDataSansChainId` (chain-agnostic domain separator) so the domain      does NOT include chainId. Instead, chainId is embedded in the struct hash.

isInitialized(address).details: An account is considered initialized if it has at least one credential registered.      Since onInstall requires at least one credential and removeCredential prevents      removing the last one, a zero count means never installed or fully uninstalled.

params.smartAccount: The smart account address to check

returns._0: True if the account has at least one registered credential

params.typeID: The ERC-7579 module type identifier to check

returns._0: True if this module supports the given type

isValidSignatureWithSender(address,bytes.details: The first parameter (sender) is intentionally ignored. Per ERC-7579, the smart      account calls this function on the validator module, so msg.sender IS the smart      account and is used as the account for credential lookup. The sender parameter      (which would be the original caller of the smart account's isValidSignature)      is not relevant for credential-based validation.

params.data: The packed signature data (same format as userOp.signature)
params.hash: The hash of the data to validate

returns._0: bytes4 EIP1271_SUCCESS (0x1626ba7e) if valid, EIP1271_FAILED (0xffffffff) otherwise

onInstall(bytes).details: Called by the smart account during module installation (ERC-7579 lifecycle).      msg.sender is the smart account itself, not an EOA or external caller.

params.data: abi.encode(uint16[] keyIds, WebAuthnCredential[] creds, address userGuardian, address externalGuardian, uint8 guardianThreshold)

onUninstall(bytes).details: Called by the smart account during module removal (ERC-7579 lifecycle).      msg.sender is the smart account. Iterates all enabled credKeys, deletes each      credential's public key data, removes it from the enumerable set, and clears      the guardian address.      NOTE: Used recovery nonces (in _recoveryConfig[account].nonceUsed) are intentionally      NOT cleared. This prevents replay attacks where a previously-used recovery signature      could be replayed after reinstalling the module.

recoverWithGuardian(address,uint256,(uin.details: Callable by anyone (permissionless). Signature format depends on the account's threshold:      - threshold=1: `[type_byte][sig]` where type_byte is `0x00` (user) or `0x01` (external)      - threshold=2: `[user_sig_len: uint16][user_sig][external_sig]` (both must sign)

recoverWithPasskey(address,uint256,(uint.details: Callable by anyone (permissionless) -- security relies entirely on the cryptographic      verification of the existing passkey's signature over the EIP-712 recovery digest.

removeCredential(uint16).details: msg.sender is the smart account calling this function directly. Prevents removing      the last credential to maintain a liveness guarantee -- the account must always      have at least one credential capable of signing to avoid permanent lockout.

params.keyId: 16-bit identifier of the credential to remove

params._externalGuardian: Address of the external guardian (address(0) to clear)
params._userGuardian: Address of the user guardian (address(0) to clear)

validateSignatureForAccount(address,byte.details: Exposes the internal validation for use by delegated validators (e.g.,      OneAuthAppValidator). The EIP-712 domain (including verifyingContract = address(this))      is computed by this contract.      The caller is responsible for binding any additional context into the digest before      calling this function. For example, OneAuthAppValidator pre-hashes      keccak256(abi.encode(appAccount, originalDigest)) to prevent cross-account replay.

params.account: The account whose credentials to verify against (also bound into the challenge)
params.data: The packed signature data (same format as userOp.signature)
params.digest: The hash to validate (may be pre-bound by the caller)

returns._0: True if the signature is valid

validateSignatureWithData(bytes32,bytes,.details: Unlike the stateful validateUserOp / isValidSignatureWithSender paths, this function      does not look up credentials by account. Instead, the caller provides the public key      and validation parameters in `data`, and the WebAuthn signature in `signature`.      This enables off-chain verifiers to validate signatures without the module being installed.      NOTE: Unlike the stateful validation paths (validateUserOp, isValidSignatureWithSender)      which return false/VALIDATION_FAILED on invalid input per ERC-4337, this function REVERTS      on malformed input (InvalidSignatureData, ProofTooLong, InvalidMerkleProof). It only      returns false for valid-format-but-wrong-signature cases (when WebAuthn.verify fails).      The `data` layout starts with a 20-byte account address (for challenge binding),      followed by the credential/proof data:        [0:20]    account (address, bound into the challenge)        [20]      proofLength (uint8)        if proofLength == 0 (regular signing, challenge = _passkeyDigest(account, hash)):          [21:53]                        pubKeyX          [53:85]                        pubKeyY        if proofLength > 0 (merkle proof, challenge = _passkeyMultichain(merkleRoot)):          [21:53]                        merkleRoot (bytes32)          [53:53+proofLength*32]         proof (bytes32[])          [proofEnd:proofEnd+32]         pubKeyX          [proofEnd+32:proofEnd+64]      pubKeyY      `signature` is packed WebAuthnAuth (see P256Lib.parseWebAuthnAuth for format).

params.data: Packed account, credential, and proof data as described above
params.hash: The digest to validate (or combined with account for a merkle leaf)
params.signature: Packed WebAuthnAuth struct (r, s, challengeIndex, typeIndex, authenticatorData, clientDataJSON)

returns._0: True if the signature is valid for the provided credentials

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.details: The account address is userOp.sender, NOT msg.sender (msg.sender is the EntryPoint).      Returns VALIDATION_SUCCESS (0) if the signature is valid, or VALIDATION_FAILED (1)      otherwise. Must never revert per ERC-4337 spec -- all failure cases return      VALIDATION_FAILED instead.

params.userOp: The packed user operation containing the signature in userOp.signature
params.userOpHash: The hash of the user operation (used as the digest to verify)

addCredential(uint16,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Add a new credential with a specific keyId

credentialCount(address).notice: Get the number of credentials for an account

getAccountLeaf(address,bytes32).notice: Compute the account-bound merkle leaf for a given account and digest

getCredKeys(address).notice: Get all enabled credential keys for an account

getCredential(uint16,address).notice: Get the P-256 public key coordinates for a specific credential

getPasskeyDigest(address,bytes32).notice: Compute the passkey challenge for a single operation digest (chain-specific)

getPasskeyMultichain(bytes32).notice: Compute the passkey challenge for a merkle root (chain-agnostic)

getRecoverDigest(address,uint256,(uint16.notice: Computes the EIP-712 recovery digest for off-chain or on-chain verification

guardianConfig(address).notice: Returns the full guardian configuration for an account

guardianThreshold(address).notice: Returns the effective guardian threshold for an account (defaults to 1 if unset)

isInitialized(address).notice: Check whether the module is installed for a given smart account

isModuleType(uint256).notice: ERC-7579 module type check -- reports this module as both a standard validator         (TYPE_VALIDATOR) and a stateless validator (TYPE_STATELESS_VALIDATOR)

isValidSignatureWithSender(address,bytes.notice: EIP-1271 signature validation (called by the smart account)

nonceUsed(address,uint256).notice: Checks whether a specific recovery nonce has been consumed for an account

onInstall(bytes).notice: Install the module with initial credentials and optional guardian config

onUninstall(bytes).notice: Uninstall the module, clearing all credentials and guardian

recoverWithGuardian(address,uint256,(uin.notice: Recovers an account by adding or replacing a credential, authorized by guardian(s)

recoverWithPasskey(address,uint256,(uint.notice: Recovers an account by adding or replacing a credential, authorized by an existing passkey

setGuardianConfig(address,address,uint8).notice: Set or change the guardian configuration for the caller's account

validateSignatureForAccount(address,byte.notice: Validate a signature against a specific account's stored credentials

validateSignatureWithData(bytes32,bytes,.notice: ERC-7579 stateless validation extension -- credentials are provided externally         in `data` rather than fetched from on-chain storage

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.notice: ERC-4337 user operation validation (called by the EntryPoint)
